intro: Hesperis exacodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of pink or purple, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hesperis exacodes is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
